ElementDescription: The NDAR Global Unique Identifier (GUID) for research subject
Subject ID how it's defined in lab/project
Date on which the interview/genetic test/sampling/imaging/biospecimen was completed. MM/DD/YYYY
Age in months at the time of the interview/test/sampling/imaging.
Notes: Age is rounded to chronological month. If the research participant is 15-days-old at time of interview, the appropriate value would be 0 months. If the participant is 16-days-old, the value would be 1 month.
M = Male; F = Female; O=Other; NR = Not reported

ElementDescription: Before today's event, have you ever experienced an event in which you thought you or someone you cared about would be seriously injured or killed?
Can you tell me briefly what happened to you that brought you to the ER today?
Please rate how severe this trauma was for you:
Notes: 0=Not at All; 1=Mildly Severe; 2=Somewhat Severe; 3=Clearly Severe; 4=Very Severe; 5=Near Death

ElementDescription: During or after the event that brought you to the ER today, how detached did you feel from yourself and/or your surroundings (for example, unreal, out of body, like it was almost happening to someone else, etc)?
Notes: 0=Not at All; 1=Mildly Severe; 2=Somewhat Severe; 3=Clearly Severe; 4=Very Severe; 5=Near Death

ElementDescription: Did you have a rough childhood or any bad experiences as a child, worse than what you think most people experience? (e.g., neglect, emotional or physical or sexual abuse/assault, witnessing trauma?
Do any of your first degree relatives (parents, siblings) have problems with their nerves, anxiety or depression, drinking or drugs?
SUM CALCULATION- Current trauma severity 3 or higher?
SUM CALCULATION- Dissociation during current trauma 2 or higher?
SUM CALCULATION- Family history of psychopathology?
